New Records: Dinesh Karthik scored his maiden T20I half-century.
Avesh Khan recorded his career-best figures of 4/18.
It was South Africa's lowest total in T20 Internationals in India.
Key Match Events: Avesh Khan took 4 wickets for 18 runs.
India beat South Africa by 82 runs.
South Africa collapsed to 87 for nine in 16.5 overs.
Temba Bavuma retired hurt after injuring his left elbow.
Quinton de Kock was run out after a mix-up with Dwaine Pretorious.
India amassed 73 runs in the last five overs.
Rishabh Pant and Hardik Pandya had a 41-run stand.
Hardik Pandya hammered Tabraiz Shamsi for successive sixes.
Rishabh Pant was dismissed after edging a wide ball to short third man.
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa won their fourth toss in as many games.
South Africa's lead bowler Kagiso Rabada was absent due to an injury.
Wayne Parnell also missed the game due to an injury.
Quinton de Kock made a return to the team at the expense of Reeza Hendricks.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch remained tricky to bat on with the odd ball gripping and rising sharply from good length.
The series decider will be played in Bengaluru on Sunday.
